metadata.title: CVE-2016-4352 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the demuxer function in libmpdemux/demux_gif.c inMplayer allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) vialarge dimensions in a gif file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4352` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mencoder - 2:1.3.0-2
mplayer - 2:1.3.0-2
mplayer-gui - 2:1.3.0-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mplayer package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:1.3.0-2').
